column32: Get funding for own Vehicles ( shuttles and transportation services) roughly R400 000 is needed. To get more exposure and have more clients in the corporate and leisure side of business.  The business is growing from where we started from but we need more fixed term contacts with our clients and boast sales.
column33:
There is a need for funding for him to build marketing tools e.g., advertising, Promoting the business in various online platforms. Our own vehicles are also required eventually in order to take visitors to other parts of North West and surrounding areas, the Kruger National Park and the rest of South Africa. Having to outsource transport and the owner being the tour guide and driver, restricts the business to expand or cater for more groups due to availability. Presently the owner is contributing his time at low cost to build the business. 
Sales figures must be segmented to separate income, expenditure, and profitability from each segment. He will then be able to determine an accurate view of the segments improving in Income and profitability and this will give him an analysis of which segment to focus on more in marketing. 
He needs to be cautious not to incur additional expenditure without proper financial analysis and to constantly watch his expenditure.  
To improve his cash flow and income he must implement advertising & marketing initiatives, changes & enhancements in the short, medium & long term.  
Implement administrative systems to record bookings, Invoicing, Payments, expenses, and other costs which must be available daily if not weekly to control cash flow.
column34:
•	Trip Organization and Planning:

Comprehensive trip organization and planning services for individuals, families, and groups.
Customized itineraries tailored to specific interests, preferences, and budgets.
Assistance in selecting the best destinations, attractions, and activities based on client requirements.

•	Transportation Services:

Arrangement of flights, including domestic and international bookings.
Ground transportation services, such as airport transfers, private car rentals, and chauffeur services.
Coordination of intercity or regional transportation, including train and bus tickets. 
•	Accommodation Arrangements:

Booking of accommodation ranging from budget-friendly guesthouses to luxury resorts and hotels.
Selection of accommodation options based on location, amenities, and client preferences.
Special arrangements for unique stays, such as lodges, safari camps, and boutique accommodations.

•	Tailor-Made Trips:

Customized travel experiences designed to cater to specific client preferences and interests.
Tailor-made itineraries that include a mix of activities, destinations, and accommodations.
Flexibility to incorporate specific requests, such as special occasions, cultural experiences, or adventure activities.

•	Guided Tours and Excursions:

Organized guided tours to popular attractions, landmarks, and natural wonders.
Knowledgeable local guides providing insights into history, culture, and wildlife.
Themed tours focusing on specific interests, such as food, wine, art, or wildlife.

•	Adventure and Outdoor Activities:

Arrangement of thrilling adventure activities, including hiking, rock climbing, and ziplining.
Water-based adventures such as scuba diving, and kayaking.

•	Wildlife experiences, including safari drives, game walks, and birdwatching. Group Travel and Events:

Planning and coordination of group travel for corporate events, incentive trips, or educational tours.
Assistance in organizing conferences, meetings, and team-building activities.

•	Customized group packages, including accommodation, transportation, and activities. Travel Consultation and Advice:

Consultation services to provide expert advice and recommendations for travel plans.
Destination information, including insights on local customs, cultural etiquette, and safety precautions.
Up-to-date travel advisories and alerts to ensure informed decision-making.

column32:
Expand Product Line: Introduce new and innovative furniture designs to cater to a broader market.
Increase Market Share: Strengthen our presence in existing markets and penetrate new geographic regions.
Enhance Customer Experience: Improve customer service and satisfaction through personalized services and after-sales support.
Sustainability Initiatives: Implement sustainable manufacturing practices and source eco-friendly materials.
Digital Transformation: Invest in digital marketing strategies and e-commerce platforms to boost online sales.
Operational Efficiency: Streamline production processes to reduce costs and improve efficiency.
Strategic Partnerships: Form alliances with key suppliers and retailers to enhance supply chain and distribution networks.
column33:
Current Challenges: We are facing challenges in sourcing high-quality, sustainable materials at competitive prices. Additionally, maintaining consistent production timelines amidst fluctuating demand is an area of focus.

Investment Opportunities: We are open to potential investors interested in supporting our growth and expansion plans, particularly those with expertise in the furniture industry.

Workforce Development: We are committed to investing in our employees through continuous training and development programs to enhance skills and productivity.

Technological Advancements: We are exploring advanced manufacturing technologies such as automation and AI-driven processes to improve product quality and operational efficiency.

Community Engagement: We prioritize community engagement and aim to support local artisans and craftsmen by incorporating their skills and techniques into our designs.

Custom Solutions: We offer custom furniture solutions for both residential and commercial clients, emphasizing unique designs tailored to individual needs and preferences.

column11: National Nated Diploma Engineering Studies Mechanical
column32:
My aim is to establish a modern workshop equipped with cutting-edge technology and tools essential for high-quality steel fabrication. This facility will cater specifically to the specialized needs of local mines and organizations in Thabazimbi and surrounding areas.
I am committed to hiring and training 5 full-time Boilermakers from within our community. These positions will not only provide stable employment but also foster a skilled workforce capable of delivering exceptional fabrication services under my guidance and leadership.
Leveraging my qualifications as a Qualified Boilermaker with a National Diploma in Engineering Studies, Assessor, and Moderator, I plan to mentor and develop apprentices within our workshop. This initiative aims to empower local youth by imparting valuable skills and knowledge in the field of steel fabrication.
Our goal extends beyond business success to making a meaningful impact on the local economy. By investing in training and employment opportunities, we aim to contribute positively to the socioeconomic fabric of Thabazimbi, supporting sustainable growth and development.
Through our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction, we aspire to establish our workshop as a preferred provider of specialized steel fabrication services. Our focus on quality craftsmanship and reliability will differentiate us in the market, earning the trust and loyalty of our clients.
column33: No
column34: Steel Fabrication - Steel Construction - Maintenance - Supplies

column32: Get compliant with all regulatory requirements/bodies, acquire petroleum export/import licenses aligned with the Missile Tecnology Control Regime (MTCR), test the market (Space launch companies), then get into market. Our path to commercialisation is relatively complex and simple, I don't know how but it works.
column33:
Victorius Petroleum is South African broker and supplier of rocket propellant. Here's why:

Modern rocket propellants are typically specialized chemicals like liquid hydrogen, Kerosene (RP-1), liquid oxygen, or hypergolic fuels. These require special refining processes beyond the scope of a regular petroleum company. We act as a broker between Rocket companies a Petroleum companies specializing in Refined rocket & spacecraft propellant.
column34: Sourcing and supply of Rocket propellant mainly: Refined form of KEROSENE (RP-1) and Liquid Oxygen (LOX). Consultancy services in the Space industry.

column32:
1. Increase Market Reach:

Year 1: Establish a strong online presence with a fully functional website and active social media channels.
Year 2: Partner with local businesses and event planners to offer catering services.
Year 3: Expand delivery services to neighboring towns and cities.

2. Boost Brand Awareness:
Year 1: Implement a local advertising campaign including flyers, local newspaper ads, and participation in community events.
Year 2: Launch targeted online marketing campaigns using social media ads, Google Ads, and influencer partnerships.
Year 3: Secure features in local and regional food blogs and magazines.

3. Enhance Customer Experience:

Year 1: Implement a customer loyalty program to reward repeat customers.
Year 2: Develop a mobile app for easy ordering, tracking, and customer feedback.
Year 3: Achieve a customer satisfaction rating of 90% or higher through continuous improvement of products and services.
column33:
Current Market Position:

Business Awareness:
Mmane Tiro Kota and Business Cakes is fairly well-known in our local area. We have a loyal customer base that has grown steadily over the past few years."
Sales Figures and Customer Base:
Currently, we serve around 150 customers per week, with an average weekly revenue of [2500].

2. Target Audience:

Primary Customers:
Our primary customers are young adults and families, typically aged 18-35. They enjoy convenient, delicious meals and treats.

Customer Segments to Attract:

We aim to attract more corporate clients and event planners for catering services.

3. Unique Selling Points (USPs):
Distinctiveness:
Our kotas and cakes stand out due to our unique recipes, high-quality ingredients, and customizable options. Our signature product, Riverside Heaven, is particularly popular.

Special Products:
We have a signature line of cakes that include flavors and designs not commonly found in the local market.

 Marketing Efforts:
Current Channels:
We currently use social media platforms like Facebook and our website.

4. Operational Capacity:
Staff and Production:
We have a team of 3 staff members, including bakers and kitchen assistants. Our current production capacity allows us to serve up to 150 customers per week.
Plans to Scale:

We plan to hire more staff and invest in additional kitchen equipment to increase our production capacity.

column11: Risk Assessment certificate and grade twelve
column33:
Equipment and Tools
Gold Pans and Sluice Boxes: Basic tools for manual gold prospecting1.
Portable Rock Crushers: Compact crushers designed for on-site processing1.
Metal Detectors: Used for locating gold nuggets1.
Drills and Ventilation Systems: Necessary for more extensive mining operations2.
Safety Gear: Helmets, overalls, protective gloves, and other safety equipment2.
2. Processing Equipment
Centrifugal Concentrators: For recovering precious metals from alluvial sands3.
Hydraulic Jigs: Used to concentrate coarse gold nuggets3.
Wash Plants: For processing alluvial sands and clays3.
3. Support Infrastructure
Water Supply: Essential for processing and washing minerals.
Power Supply: Generators or access to electricity for operating machinery.
Storage Facilities: For storing equipment and processed materials.
4. Legal and Regulatory Compliance
Permits and Licenses: Ensure you have the necessary legal permissions to operate.
Environmental Impact Assessments: To comply with local environmental regulations.
5. Training and Safety Programs
Training for Workers: On the use of equipment and safety protocols.
Health and Safety Programs: To ensure a safe working environment.
6. Financial Resources
Initial Capital: For purchasing equipment and setting up operations.
Operational Funds: For ongoing expenses such as fuel, maintenance, and wages.

column32:
Mashtown Trading Enterprise aims to achieve the following goals over the next 1-3 years:

Expand Service Offerings: We plan to diversify and expand our range of services in the construction, printing, and business solutions sectors. This includes launching new services such as company registrations and compliance solutions.

Increase Market Share: By strengthening our marketing efforts and enhancing customer satisfaction, we aim to increase our market share within the Mashishing area and beyond. We are focused on securing more contracts with both private and public sector clients.

Enhance Operational Efficiency: We will invest in training and development for our staff to improve productivity and service quality. Implementing advanced project management and operational systems will streamline our processes and reduce costs.

Community Impact: As part of our commitment to social responsibility, we aim to create more employment opportunities for local youth and contribute to community development projects.

Sustainable Growth: We are dedicated to building a sustainable business model by adopting environmentally friendly practices and ensuring long-term financial stability.

These goals will guide our efforts to grow our business while making a positive impact on our community.
column33:
Mashtown Trading Enterprise has a strong foundation built on years of experience and a deep commitment to excellence in service delivery. To further our growth and impact, we would like to share the following key aspects and needs of our business:

Training and Development: Continuous learning is vital for our team. We seek opportunities for advanced training in project management, technical skills, and business operations to stay competitive and deliver high-quality services.

Access to Finance: To support our expansion plans and execute larger projects, we require access to financial resources. This includes securing funding or loans that will allow us to invest in new equipment, technology, and workforce development.

Networking Opportunities: Building relationships with other businesses, industry experts, and potential clients is crucial. We welcome opportunities to network through events, forums, and partnerships that can open doors to new contracts and collaborations.

Technology Integration: As we grow, integrating advanced technology into our operations will be essential. Support in adopting digital tools and platforms for project management, customer relationship management (CRM), and financial tracking would greatly enhance our efficiency.

Market Access: Expanding our market reach is a priority. Assistance in accessing new markets, both locally and nationally, through marketing support and strategic partnerships would be invaluable.

Sustainability Practices: We are committed to implementing sustainable practices in our operations. Guidance and resources to help us adopt eco-friendly methods and meet environmental standards are important to us.

By addressing these needs, we believe Mashtown Trading Enterprise can achieve significant growth and contribute positively to the economy and community.
column34:
Mashtown Trading Enterprise specializes in a diverse range of products and services, catering to various industries and sectors. Our primary offerings include:

Construction Services:

Fencing: Installation of high-security and medium-security fencing, including galvanized steel palisade fences and ClearVu pressed mesh panels.
Civil Engineering: Undertaking various civil construction projects, including bulk earthworks and structural foundations.
Electrical Reticulation: Providing comprehensive electrical reticulation services, including the installation and maintenance of electrical systems for residential, commercial, and industrial projects.
Printing Services:

Commercial Printing: Providing high-quality printing solutions for marketing materials, business stationery, and promotional items.
Custom Printing: Offering tailored printing services to meet specific client requirements, including banners, posters, and custom designs.
Business Solutions:

Company Registrations: Assisting businesses with the registration process, ensuring compliance with local regulations.
Compliance Solutions: Providing expert guidance on maintaining regulatory compliance, including tax registration and legal requirements.
Supply Chain Services:

Procurement: Sourcing and supplying a wide range of products and materials, including PPE and construction materials.
Logistics: Managing the efficient transportation and delivery of goods to various locations.
These core services enable us to support our clients across multiple sectors, ensuring their projects and business operations run smoothly and efficiently.

column32:

Mashtown Trading Enterprise has a strong foundation built on years of experience and a deep commitment to excellence in service delivery. To further our growth and impact, we would like to share the following key aspects and needs of our business:

Training and Development: Continuous learning is vital for our team. We seek opportunities for advanced training in project management, technical skills, and business operations to stay competitive and deliver high-quality services.

Access to Finance: To support our expansion plans and execute larger projects, we require access to financial resources. This includes securing funding or loans that will allow us to invest in new equipment, technology, and workforce development.

Networking Opportunities: Building relationships with other businesses, industry experts, and potential clients is crucial. We welcome opportunities to network through events, forums, and partnerships that can open doors to new contracts and collaborations.

Technology Integration: As we grow, integrating advanced technology into our operations will be essential. Support in adopting digital tools and platforms for project management, customer relationship management (CRM), and financial tracking would greatly enhance our efficiency.

Market Access: Expanding our market reach is a priority. Assistance in accessing new markets, both locally and nationally, through marketing support and strategic partnerships would be invaluable.

Sustainability Practices: We are committed to implementing sustainable practices in our operations. Guidance and resources to help us adopt eco-friendly methods and meet environmental standards are important to us.

By addressing these needs, we believe Mashtown Trading Enterprise can achieve significant growth and contribute positively to the economy and community.
column34:
Mashtown Trading Enterprise specializes in a diverse range of products and services, catering to various industries and sectors. Our primary offerings include:

Construction Services:

Fencing: Installation of high-security and medium-security fencing, including galvanized steel palisade fences and ClearVu pressed mesh panels.
Civil Engineering: Undertaking various civil construction projects, including bulk earthworks and structural foundations.
Electrical Reticulation: Providing comprehensive electrical reticulation services, including the installation and maintenance of electrical systems for residential, commercial, and industrial projects.
Printing Services:

Commercial Printing: Providing high-quality printing solutions for marketing materials, business stationery, and promotional items.
Custom Printing: Offering tailored printing services to meet specific client requirements, including banners, posters, and custom designs.
Business Solutions:

Company Registrations: Assisting businesses with the registration process, ensuring compliance with local regulations.
Compliance Solutions: Providing expert guidance on maintaining regulatory compliance, including tax registration and legal requirements.
Supply Chain Services:

Procurement: Sourcing and supplying a wide range of products and materials, including PPE and construction materials.
Logistics: Managing the efficient transportation and delivery of goods to various locations.
These core services enable us to support our clients across multiple sectors, ensuring their projects and business operations run smoothly and efficiently.

column32:
Mashtown Trading Enterprise aims to achieve the following goals over the next 1-3 years:

Expand Service Offerings: We plan to diversify and expand our range of services in the construction, printing, and business solutions sectors. This includes launching new services such as company registrations and compliance solutions.

Increase Market Share: By strengthening our marketing efforts and enhancing customer satisfaction, we aim to increase our market share within the Mashishing area and beyond. We are focused on securing more contracts with both private and public sector clients.

Enhance Operational Efficiency: We will invest in training and development for our staff to improve productivity and service quality. Implementing advanced project management and operational systems will streamline our processes and reduce costs.

Community Impact: As part of our commitment to social responsibility, we aim to create more employment opportunities for local youth and contribute to community development projects.

Sustainable Growth: We are dedicated to building a sustainable business model by adopting environmentally friendly practices and ensuring long-term financial stability.

These goals will guide our efforts to grow our business while making a positive impact on our community.

column32: To have direct contracts so that I can be able to have more resources to execute my work & be able maximize on profits.
column33: Conquest Construction & Projects is a Cargo & Passenger Transport SMME that has been providing these services to contractors that are doing work at Waterval Smelters  for over 5 years now but the problem is we are providing all this services on an informal or verbal agreements & they are short term projects therefore you can never acquire funding or assets for your business against such agreements, so it would be better if we are contracted directly with Anglo then all these contractors request our services from Anglo then Anglo request from us then we dispatch our services to that contractor on behlaf of Anglo. By doing so we will be able to cut out the contractor & negotiate a flat-rate with Anglo eventually saving Anglo money & we will be in a position to grow our business in all aspects.

column2: The Throne Room Technical Solutions And Logistics
column32:
Year 1: Foundation and Growth
Objective 1: Strengthen Core Services

Website Development:
Increase the number of client projects by 30%.
Achieve a 95% client satisfaction rate through quality designs and user-friendly interfaces.
Email & Website Hosting:
Expand hosting services to 50 new clients.
Ensure 99.9% uptime for all hosted websites and email services.
Objective 2: Enhance Market Presence

Marketing Strategy:
Launch a comprehensive digital marketing campaign.
Increase social media following by 50%.
Attend at least 4 industry conferences to network and showcase services.
Objective 3: Diversify Product Offerings

Electronic Computing and Consumer Consumables:
Introduce a new line of high-demand electronic consumables.
Partner with 5 reputable suppliers for competitive pricing and quality.
Point of Sale (POS) Systems:
Secure 10 new business clients for POS system installations.
Provide comprehensive training sessions for new clients.
Year 2: Expansion and Innovation
Objective 1: Expand Client Base

Customer Acquisition:
Increase the overall client base by 40%.
Target medium to large enterprises with tailored IT solutions.
Objective 2: Innovate Services and Solutions

Cloud & Infrastructure:
Develop and launch a proprietary cloud service platform.
Migrate 25 existing clients to the new cloud platform.
Ensure data security and regulatory compliance for all cloud services.
Power & Security Components:
Introduce a new range of power backup and security solutions.
Partner with leading security firms to enhance service offerings.
Objective 3: Enhance Operational Efficiency

Internal Systems:
Implement a new CRM system to streamline client management and support.
Automate routine administrative tasks to improve operational efficiency.
Year 3: Leadership and Sustainability
Objective 1: Establish Industry Leadership

Reputation Building:
Gain recognition as a top IT solutions provider in at least 3 major industry publications.
Receive an industry award for excellence in service or innovation.
Objective 2: Sustainable Growth

Green Initiatives:
Implement energy-efficient practices within the company.
Launch an e-waste recycling program for clients.
Objective 3: Expand Geographical Reach

Regional Offices:
Open at least 2 new regional offices to better serve clients in different locations.
Hire and train local teams to maintain service quality.
Objective 4: Continuous Improvement and Employee Development

Staff Training and Development:
Invest in continuous professional development for employees.
Launch a leadership development program to groom future leaders within the company.
Metrics for Success
Revenue Growth: Achieve a 20% year-on-year revenue growth.
Client Retention: Maintain a client retention rate of at least 90%.
Market Share: Increase market share in targeted service areas by 15%.
Employee Satisfaction: Achieve an employee satisfaction score of 85% or higher.
column33: We would also appreciate a base of operations
column34:
Technical Solutions:
- Supplying computer equipment( laptops, desktops,printers, ink,etc)
- System administration, network setup and maintenance, cybersecurity solutions, and IT support.
- Custom software solutions, mobile and web application development.
- Workshops and training programs in basic coding, IT skills, and digital literacy.

Logistics:
- Coordination of supply chain activities, including procurement, transportation, and distribution.
- Storage solutions, inventory management, and warehouse operations.
- Freight and cargo transportation, delivery services, and logistics planning.

column33:
Waratwa Corp (PTY) LTD is a black owned company that situated in the industrial and mining area of Steelpoort in Fetakgomo Tubatse local municipality, Sekhukhune district, Limpopo province. Waratwa Corp is 100% black owned company by a young entrepreneur and he is still in his youth ages. We highly belief in honesty, quality and integrity so our clients can be happy with our services all the time, therefore our reputation is very important. 

Waratwa Corp (PTY) LTD has the potential and ability to be one of the most successful enterprise companies, mostly in Africa because it’s a flexible company that develops our employees’ skills in order to improve and enhance the quality of our services. Our ethos as a company is NO GUTS NO GLORY which clearly explains that our services have no limits.

	SUPPLY

column32:
My business goals for Hon Botas Poultry Farm Pty Ltd over the next 1-3 years include:

Expanding Production Capacity: Increase the number of chickens to meet growing market demand.
Improving Infrastructure: Upgrade facilities and equipment to enhance efficiency and productivity.
Market Expansion: Explore new markets and distribution channels to broaden our customer base.
Sustainability Initiatives: Implement eco-friendly practices and improve waste management.
Research and Development: Invest in research to improve chicken breeds and production techniques.
Employee Development: Provide training and development opportunities for staff to improve skills and productivity.
column33:
Yes, additional information about Hon Botas Poultry Farm Pty Ltd includes:

Funding Requirements: We are seeking funding to support our expansion and infrastructure improvement plans.
Partnership Opportunities: We are open to collaborations with other businesses and research institutions to enhance our operations and innovation.
Community Engagement: We aim to contribute to local communities through job creation and agricultural education programs.
Quality Assurance: Maintaining high standards of quality and animal welfare is a top priority.
Technology Integration: We plan to incorporate advanced technologies to streamline operations and improve efficiency.
column34:
The primary products and services of Hon Botas Poultry Farm Pty Ltd include:

Broilers: Chickens raised specifically for meat production.
Layers: Chickens raised for egg production.
Boschveld Indigenous Chickens: A breed known for its adaptability and hardiness.
Crossbreeds: Chickens bred to combine desirable traits from different breeds.
Consulting Services: Offering expertise in poultry farming and animal production.
Research and Development: Conducting studies to improve poultry breeds and production methods.
Educating locals and offer consultants

column32: When I look back in the year 2019 when I started to own my office with the help of NYDA funding as young as I am in this field of finance it was not easy at all but since for me becoming an Accountant was a passion everything was possible. First, I took the right path and registered with CIBA which is known as SAIBA as Business Accountant In Practice (BAP) until now. From now on I want to expand my business e,g to have my own land and build the firm to be a hand office where i would accommodate trainee accountants since now am working with Sekhukhune Tvet College am one of their stakeholder we host their student for 18 months which are from local. We aim at having permanent and qualified accountants and more branches from different provinces .
column33: I want to emphasize that Janericon Accountants is not just an Accounting firm but is a number one stop accounting firm which specializes in Accounting Services, Graphic Solutions, and Website Development. We also offer software training for small or medium businesses. We have designed packages for clients which those who are under graphics need us to outsource for printing and all our profit goes to the supplier so we can do everything from designing but we need printing machines for final products to be delivered to our clients. We have proof of projects we did for our clients which if we had our own machines the company would have grown and graphics contribute a lot from the business. I would also appreciate it if the Anglo American can put us from their database for opportunities like helping SMME with their compliance even if there is a container so that they can quickly find us when they need help.

column32:
Currently operating as a developing small business that is looking at growing the business/Company into a world class Public Relations Agency aiming at small businesses and upcoming creatives, the ultimate business plan for the next 1 to 3 years is to establish a community creative/business hub that will cater for all unemployed graduates, youth Enterprenuers, creatives and small businesses owners in and around my community of Lebowakgomo in the Limpopo province.

The creative hub will assist the community in finding all the information they need regarding their business development and also create a space for them to come togather and work togather to fight unemployment and grow the township economy through Enterprenuership, this space will empower and encourage collaborations and different types of partnerships, trainings and skills development programs. 

Looking at the unemployment rate in South Africa currently,which also includes graduates I think this initiative will come in very useful as a way of educating them that they can still go out there and use what they have studied towards and be their own bosses considering their fields of study, and this will help create employment in our communities.

column33:
Polokwane Photographer Pty Ltd T/A POLOKWANE HOLDINGS is 100% black young men-owned, founded and directed by Nakedi Ragedi,registered in the year 2019 T/A POLOKWANE HOLDINGS ,The company was established after the identification of need in the small and medium enterprises sector for development, coordination and consolidation of skills and experience in all sectors of the industry. It aims at addressing the increased unemployment rate caused by the depression of trade sectors, retrenchments and other industry mechanizations. This was and still is being achieved after establishing a 
close corporation with the following as its principal business activities.


POLOKWANE HOLDINGS has also realized the availability in abundance, of core skills and knowledge in this country, which seeks to be targeted into the group’s activities. We also developed some vocational training programs for skill development to semi –skilled and unskilled people. We thus seek to synergies skills until a competitive critical mass is achieved, to formalize these entities in term of planning, administration, and marketing and procurement functions necessary to compete satisfactorily in the open market.


POLOKWANE HOLDINGS is convinced, this philosophy is ideal means of poverty eradication and in long term Limpopo Province will emerge as one of the most competitive economies in Republic of South Africa. We also hold the economic perception that it is the combination of both macro and micro enterprises that makes the economy viable competent when compared with other economies.

We also hold the economic perception that it is the combination of both macro and micro enterprises that makes the economy viable competent when compared with other economies.

Polokwane Photographer Pty Ltd T/A POLOKWANE HOLDINGS is 100% black young men-owned, founded and directed by Nakedi Ragedi,registered in the year 2019 T/A POLOKWANE HOLDINGS ,The company was established after the identification of need in the small and medium enterprises sector for development, coordination and consolidation of skills and experience in all sectors of the industry. It aims at addressing the increased unemployment rate caused by the depression of trade sectors, retrenchments and other industry mechanizations. This was and still is being achieved after establishing a 
close corporation with the following as its principal business activities.


POLOKWANE HOLDINGS has also realized the availability in abundance, of core skills and knowledge in this country, which seeks to be targeted into the group’s activities. We also developed some vocational training programs for skill development to semi –skilled and unskilled people. We thus seek to synergies skills until a competitive critical mass is achieved, to formalize these entities in term of planning, administration, and marketing and procurement functions necessary to compete satisfactorily in the open market.


POLOKWANE HOLDINGS is convinced, this philosophy is ideal means of poverty eradication and in long term Limpopo Province will emerge as one of the most competitive economies in Republic of South Africa. We also hold the economic perception that it is the combination of both macro and micro enterprises that makes the economy viable competent when compared with other economies.

column32: Year 1: Foundation and Pilot Phase,Develop and Launch WasteLink App:Create and deploy the WasteLink mobile app to connect residents, businesses, and waste collectors, aiming to streamline waste management processes.Pilot Projects in Key Regions:Implement WasteLink in three major cities and two rural areas to test its effectiveness and gather data for further improvements.Community Engagement and Education:Educate 20,000 community members on sustainable waste practices through workshops, training sessions, and app-based content.Initial Job Creation:Create 200 new jobs in the waste management sector by training unemployed individuals and partnering with local businesses.Year 2: Expansion and Optimization, Scaling Up Operations:Expand WasteLink to five additional cities and five more rural areas based on data and feedback from pilot projects.Enhancing Recycling Rates:Increase recycling rates by 25% in participating areas through incentives, efficient collection systems, and partnerships with recycling companies.Job Growth and Economic Opportunities:Create an additional 300 jobs, totaling 500 new jobs by continuing training programs and supporting small recycling and upcycling enterprises.Year 3: Consolidation and Impact Measurement, Waste Reduction and Environmental Impact:Reduce waste sent to landfills by 30% in participating areas through comprehensive waste management plans and community education.Community Participation and Awareness:Engage 100,000 community members in waste management and sustainability initiatives, scaling educational programs and community events.Economic and Social Benefits:Achieve measurable economic benefits for participating communities, ensuring equitable distribution of opportunities, particularly for marginalized groups, and tracking improvements in community well-being and social inclusion.
column33:
Innovative Technology and Sustainable Practices: Tau Sejala Enterprise stands at the forefront of combining technology with environmental sustainability. Our WasteLink app is not just a tool for waste collection; it is a comprehensive platform that educates, engages, and connects communities. This innovative approach ensures that we are not only addressing the immediate waste management needs but also fostering a culture of sustainability.Community-Centered Approach: Our operations are deeply rooted in community engagement. By training unemployed individuals and integrating local residents into our waste management processes, we ensure that our impact is both widespread and meaningful. This approach helps in creating a sense of ownership and responsibility among community members, leading to more sustainable practices.Strategic Partnerships: We have successfully built partnerships with local governments, businesses, and community organizations. These partnerships are crucial for expanding our reach and ensuring the success of our initiatives. Our collaboration with local authorities helps in streamlining waste management processes and improving the overall efficiency of our operations.Scalability and Replicability: One of the key strengths of our model is its scalability. The success of our pilot projects in Limpopo and Northern Cape demonstrates that our model can be replicated in other regions. With the necessary funding and resources, we aim to expand our operations to more provinces, reaching a larger population and having a greater impact.Financial Sustainability: While our primary focus is on environmental sustainability and community empowerment, we also ensure that our operations are financially sustainable. By creating job opportunities and supporting local businesses, we contribute to the economic development of the regions we operate in. This financial sustainability is crucial for the long-term success and impact of our initiatives.

Support and Funding Needs: To achieve our ambitious goals, we require support in several areas:

Funding for Expansion: We need additional funding to develop and launch the WasteLink app, expand our operations to new regions, and scale up our community engagement and educational programs.

Technological Development: Investment in technology is crucial for the development of the WasteLink app and other innovative solutions to streamline our operations.

Capacity Building: Training and capacity building for our team and the communities we serve are essential for the success of our initiatives. This includes training in waste management practices, app usage, and community engagement.

Infrastructure Development: To support our expanding operations, we need to invest in infrastructure, including additional landfills and upcycling facilities.
column34:
1.Waste Management Services:
Residential Waste Collection: Providing waste collection services to households, particularly in rural areas where such services are often lacking. This includes regular pickups and proper disposal of household waste.Commercial Waste Management: Offering waste management solutions to businesses, including waste collection, sorting, and disposal services.

2. Upcycling and Recycling:
Eco-friendly Products: Manufacturing products crafted from both recyclable and non-recyclable materials. These eco-friendly products are practical for home use and contribute to reducing waste.Upcycling Initiatives: Transforming waste materials into valuable products through innovative upcycling processes, which helps reduce the amount of waste sent to landfills.

3. WasteLink App:Platform for Waste Management: The WasteLink app connects residents, businesses, and waste collectors, streamlining the waste collection process. It allows users to schedule pickups, track waste collection, and access educational content on sustainable waste practices.

4. Training and Employment:Training Programs: Providing training for unemployed individuals in waste management practices. This empowers them with skills to provide professional waste management services.Job Creation: Creating job opportunities in the waste management sector, thus contributing to economic development and reducing unemployment in the communities we serve.

5. Community Engagement and Education:
Sustainable Practices Education: Organizing workshops, training sessions, and community outreach programs to educate the public on sustainable waste management practices.Community Collaboration: Working with schools, community organizations, and local governments to promote environmental sustainability and engage the community in waste management initiatives.

column32: Becoming a leading company nation wide
To actively participate in mainstream of local mining opportunities

1. **Market Expansion**:
   - Expand services to new geographic areas.
   - Increase market share within existing service areas.

2. **Service Diversification**:
   - Introduce new cleaning services (e.g., eco-friendly cleaning, specialized commercial cleaning).
   - Develop additional services like maintenance 

3. **Customer Satisfaction**:
   - Improve customer satisfaction scores through enhanced training and quality control.
   - Implement a robust feedback system to continually improve services.

4. **Operational Efficiency**:
   - Invest in advanced cleaning technology and equipment.
   - Streamline operations to reduce costs and improve service delivery times.

5. **Sustainability**:
   - Adopt environmentally friendly cleaning products and practices.
   - Achieve sustainability certifications.

6. **Employee Development**:
   - Enhance employee training programs.
   - Improve employee retention through better benefits and career development opportunities.

7. **Digital Transformation**:
   - Implement a user-friendly booking and management system.
   - Utilize data analytics to better understand customer needs and improve service delivery.

8. **Financial Growth**:
   - Increase revenue through strategic marketing and sales efforts.
   - Manage expenses to improve profitability.

column32:
1. **Increase revenue growth**: Achieve a minimum of 15% annual revenue growth through new project wins, increased productivity, and improved pricing.
2. **Expand geographic presence**: Establish a presence in new regions or markets, such as expanding into new districts , and cities.
3. **Diversify services**: Offer new services to existing clients and explore new markets, such as drilling and blasting, geotechnical services, or environmental remediation.
4. **Improve operational efficiency**: Implement process improvements, such as digitalization of workflows, to reduce costs and increase productivity.
5. **Enhance safety record**: Achieve a strong safety record by implementing robust safety protocols and training programs
column34:
**Services:**

1. **Earthwork and excavation**: Grading, excavation, and hauling of soil, rocks, and other materials for infrastructure projects.
2. **Site preparation**: Clearing and preparing land for construction projects, including demolition, excavation, and removal of debris.
3. **Concrete construction**: Pouring foundations, walls, floors, and other concrete structures for buildings, roads, and infrastructure projects.
4. **Heavy civil construction**: Building large-scale infrastructure projects such as highways, bridges, tunnels, and dams.
5. **Drilling and blasting**: Drilling holes for foundations, pipes, or other purposes, and blasting rock or soil to facilitate excavation or construction.
6. **Environmental remediation**: Cleaning up contaminated sites, removing hazardous materials, and restoring ecosystems.
7. **Infrastructure maintenance**: Repairing and maintaining existing infrastructure such as roads, bridges, and buildings.


**Products:**

1. **Aggregates**: Crushed stone, sand, gravel, and other aggregate materials used in construction projects.
2. **Ready-mix concrete**: Pre-mixed concrete delivered to site for use in building foundations, walls, floors, and other structures.
3. **Asphalt products**: Asphalt mixtures for paving roads and highways.
4. **Mining equipment**: Heavy machinery such as excavators, drills, haul trucks, and graders used in mining operations.
5. **Civil engineering materials**: Steel reinforcement bars (rebar), concrete pipes, valves, fittings, and other materials used in construction projects.
6. **Specialized equipment rental**: Renting heavy equipment such as excavators, TLBs, Front-End Loaders, bulldozers, and graders for short-term projects or special applications.
7. **Drilling fluids and chemicals**: Chemicals used in drilling operations to manage water flows, control drilling muds, and enhance drilling efficiency.

column32:
Our objective is to have Community Education & Training Centres in Communities where Skills Development Centres are not accessible. We also want to create Employee Skills Development Programme withing the mining sector in tes of Employee Skills Enhancement amd most importantly be part of Employee Exit Programme in helping employeees taking pension/retirement or retrenchment to explore other business opportunities through partnerahip skills programme with Anglo American.

We also want to be part of the CSI Skills programme partnership within communities where the mine is operation within the SADC region.

We opt to achieve all the above in the 3 to 5yrs
column33:
We have been offering affordable Work Readiness Skills. Programme to unemployed people since 2017 and we have offered the training in North West (Rustenburg, Vryburg, Taung, Klerksdorp) and Northern Cape (Kathu, Kuruman).

Our aim is to become a National Skills Development Centre that is mainly focused on Work Readiness amd also be a preferred Employee Development. Partner in the Mining and Ssrvice related industries including Construction Sector. 

Our main needs are mostly:

- infrastructure (Acess to having Centres in Communities where we can be acccessible - Central Venue where all communities can access us). Rental is expensive in town and also it makes our programmes to be a bit expensive.

- Equipment: We require equipment we can use both in the centre and also in mobile wnen we visit other communities that we can travel with such as, Trainin g Laptops, Kits, Tools, PPE, Training boards, Projectora etc.

Funds: We need funds/grant that can enable the business to be operational for a. Minimum. Of 8 to 12 months so that we can be able generate income. That will enable the business to reaalize a profit to be self sustainable. We are aware that we are not an NPO as we have to be profitable in a feasible future to be sustainable.

Training and Coaching: We need Business Development Training,Staff Training and Coaching to assist the business to be compliant, have strong operational steucture and more confident team that can adapt to the changing world of work.

Compliance : Accreditation with the QCTO on more Qualifications that are more. Technical amd agricultural sonthatbwe can be relevant to the Mining and other technical sector, and the agricultural programme can also assist in the Environmental Development programme.

column33: Quality Equipment and Supplies: to get high-quality cleaning equipment and supplies that are effective and durable. This includes vacuum cleaners, mops, cleaning agents, and specialized tools for different surfaces
column34:
Residential Cleaning: General cleaning services for homes, including dusting, vacuuming, mopping, kitchen and bathroom cleaning, and tidying up living spaces.

Commercial Cleaning: Cleaning services for businesses, offices, and commercial spaces, including dusting, vacuuming, mopping, restroom cleaning, and trash removal.

Deep Cleaning: Intensive cleaning services that cover areas often missed in regular cleanings, such as behind appliances, inside cabinets, and detailed cleaning of surfaces and fixtures.

Carpet and Upholstery Cleaning: Specialized cleaning for carpets, rugs, and upholstered furniture using steam cleaning or other methods to remove stains and dirt.

Window Cleaning: Professional cleaning of windows, including interior and exterior surfaces, window frames, and sills.

Move-In/Move-Out Cleaning: Thorough cleaning services for homes and apartments before new occupants move in or after previous occupants move out, ensuring the space is spotless.

Post-Construction Cleaning: Cleaning services tailored for newly constructed or renovated buildings, removing dust, debris, and construction residues.

Floor Care Services: Maintenance and cleaning of different types of flooring, including hardwood, tile, vinyl, and laminate, which may include stripping, waxing, and polishing.

Green Cleaning: Eco-friendly cleaning services using environmentally safe products and sustainable practices to minimize the environmental impact.

Special Event Cleaning: Cleaning services before, during, and after special events such as weddings, parties, and corporate functions to ensure the venue is clean and presentable.

column33: Our Company aims to lead in safety, transformation, development and maintenance of environmentally friendly infrastructure. Lomadco is a potentially emerging construction entity that CIDB registered (PE 1CE,1GB, 1ME). At Lomadco, sustainability is about the bigger picture. At every level of our decision-making, we’re committed to three key aspects: integrating environmental resilience, social progress, and economic health. We would like to be known for our infrastructure leadership, which includes leading the way in Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) risk management, and ensuring consistency across the entire business. We believe transforming lives is part of everyone’s role - for better communities, a better industry, and a better future - and our ESG targets are integral to achieving this.

column32: Open new branch, add new service and enhance online presence
column33:
As a black-owned and youth female-run laundry business, we're proud to be a part of the local community, but we're facing some challenges that are hindering our growth. We've been open for 7 months now, and while we've built a loyal customer base, we're struggling to reach new customers and increase our visibility.

In terms of marketing, we need help getting the word out about our services and differentiating ourselves from larger competitors. We're looking for creative and effective ways to reach potential customers and showcase our unique value proposition.

Additionally, we're in need of new equipment to increase our capacity and efficiency. We're currently operating with limited machines, which can lead to delays and impact our ability to take on new customers. Investing in new equipment would allow us to expand our services, improve our turnaround times, and better serve our customers.

column32:
Infrastructure Expansion:

Goal 1: Secure funding to expand farm infrastructure, including greenhouses, irrigation systems, and storage facilities.
This will allow for higher production capacity, better quality control, and operational efficiency, thereby meeting growing market demands and expanding market reach.

Market Diversification:

Goal 2: Expand market channels beyond local markets to regional and potentially international markets.
Diversifying markets is going to reduce dependency on local conditions and allow expansion of revenue opportunities. It requires funding for market research, partnerships with distributors, and potentially meeting export standards.

Technological Integration:

Goal 3: Invest in technology to enhance farm efficiency and productivity.
Technologies such as farm management software, precision agriculture tools, and automated irrigation systems can optimize resource use and reduce costs. Funding will be needed for initial investments and training.

Financial Viability and Profitability:

Goal 4: Achieve financial sustainability and profitability.
Funding will support initial expansion costs and operational improvements, aiming to increase revenue and achieve profitability within the three-year timeframe. Monitoring financial metrics and adjusting strategies accordingly will be crucial.

Community Engagement and Development:

Goal 5: Engage with the local community and contribute to economic development.
Explanation: Community engagement initiatives, such as training programs, job creation, and supporting local suppliers, can enhance social impact and build positive relationships. Funding will be used for community projects and outreach.

Risk Management:

Goal 6: Develop and implement risk management strategies.
Identifying and mitigating risks, such as market volatility, weather-related risks, and operational challenges, will safeguard the farm's operations and financial health. Funding may support insurance coverage, diversification strategies, and contingency planning.

column32:
Short-term goals (1 year):

1. Increase client base by 20% through targeted marketing and partnerships with schools, higher institutions, and event planners for ZEETECH e-services.
2. Launch ZeeH2O water bottled business and supply at least 10 events per month.
3. Achieve a customer satisfaction rate of 90% or higher across both businesses.

Mid-term goals (2 years):

1. Establish strategic partnerships with key stakeholders in the education, business, and events sectors.
2. Develop an online platform for streamlined service delivery and client management for ZEETECH e-services.
3. Increase revenue by 50% through expanded services and client growth in ZEETECH e-services and reach a minimum of 50 events per month for ZeeH2O.
4. Expand ZeeH2O's product offerings to include customized water bottles for corporate events and promotions.

Long-term goals (3 years):

1. Become a leading provider of e-services for students and businesses in South Africa through ZEETECH e-services.
2. Establish ZeeH2O as a premier water bottled business for events and customized water bottles in South Africa.
3. Achieve a 25% market share in the business registration and compliance services sector through ZEETECH e-services.
column33: Yes, I'd like to share that both ZeeH2O and ZEETECH e-services aim to provide exceptional customer experiences and quality services. ZeeH2O needs to expand its event services and explore eco-friendly packaging options, while ZEETECH e-services requires updated technology and infrastructure to streamline its registration and compliance services. Additionally, both businesses seek to establish strategic partnerships and increase their online presence to reach a wider audience.
column34:
ZEETECH e-services:

- Higher institution and bursary applications assistance.
- Career paths guidance (free service)
-CV revamp
-Job and internship application
-Poster design (excluding cooperate)

- Business registration and compliance services, including:
    - Company Name Reservation
    - CK (Company Certificate)
    - SARS Income Tax Number
    - Notice of Incorporation
    - Memo of Incorporation
    - BEE Certificate
- Additional services:
    - Annual Returns
    - Coida Registrations
    - PSira Registrations and Renewal
    - UIF
    - CSD
    - Passport Bookings
    - Business Profiles

ZeeH2O:

-ZeeH2O bottled water in various sizes:
    - 330ml
    - 500ml
    - 1L
    - 2L
    - 5L
Customized bottled water services for events and corporate promotions
- Supply of bottled water for:
    - School ceremonies
    - Weddings
    - Parties
    - Funerals
    - Other events

column32:
My business objectives would center on developing new business areas, expanding into new markets, raising the caliber and applicability of services rendered, and guaranteeing the dependability of my products. These objectives are meant to be dynamic and adaptable to the ever-changing demands of consumers who are looking for trustworthy products and services.
Our main business objectives for the next one to three years are to expand market reach by gaining more clients by targeting new demographics and geographic areas. Improve our product offering by creating and introducing fresh goods and services that cater to changing consumer demands and tastes. In addition, streamline internal procedures and increase productivity to optimize operations, cut expenses, and boost overall business agility. To remain competitive and keep ahead of industry trends. Invest in innovation by cultivating an innovative culture through putting measures into place to increase the engagement and loyalty of current clients through individualized experiences and exceptional service. In addition to these, one of the business aims is to achieve sustainable revenue growth to support continued expansion while preserving profitability and sound financial standing.
column33: The business is a start up and there is a lack of resources, having access to these resources can propel the business to greater heights. Skills development is also a critical component of any business and the provision of these skills can go a long way.

column32:
Year 1: Establishing a Strong Foundation
1. **Market Penetration**:
   - Secure contracts with at least 10 major construction companies.
   - Achieve a market share of 5% in the local scaffolding market.

2. **Operational Excellence**:
   - Set up a robust inventory management system to track scaffolding materials.
   - Hire and train a team of 15 skilled workers.

3. **Brand Building**:
   - Develop a comprehensive marketing strategy, including an optimized website and active social media presence.
   - Participate in at least 3 industry trade shows or exhibitions to increase brand visibility.

4. **Safety and Compliance**:
   - Ensure all staff are trained in safety protocols and certified in compliance with industry standards.
   - Conduct quarterly safety audits to maintain high safety standard 
Year 2: Expansion and Growth
1. **Geographic Expansion**:
   - Expand operations to two new cities or regions.
   - Establish partnerships with local suppliers and contractors in the new markets.

2. **Revenue Goals**:
   - Increase annual revenue by 50% compared to Year 1.
   - Diversify service offerings to include custom scaffolding solutions and maintenance services.

3. **Customer Satisfaction**:
   - Implement a customer feedback system to continually improve service quality.
   - Achieve a customer satisfaction rate of at least 90%.

4. **Innovation and Technology**:
   - Invest in advanced scaffolding technology and equipment to improve efficiency.
   - Develop a mobile app for better project management and client communication.

Year 3: Leading the Market
1. **Market Leadership**:
   - Capture a 15% market share in the regional scaffolding market.
   - Become a preferred scaffolding provider for at least 20 major construction firms.

2. **Financial Stability**:
   - Achieve a net profit margin of 20%.
   - Build a financial reserve to support further expansion and innovation.

3. **Sustainability Initiatives**:
   - Implement eco-friendly practices in operations, such as recycling materials and reducing waste.
   - Obtain industry certifications for sustainability and environmental responsibility.

4. **Talent Development**:
   - Establish an in-house training program to continuously upgrade employee skills.
   - Create a leadership development program to identify and nurture future leaders within the company.
column33:
Building the Foundation
Capital and Funding
   - Secure initial funding to purchase essential scaffolding equipment and materials.
   - Establish a line of credit or obtain a business loan for operational expenses.

Infrastructure and Equipment
   - Acquire high-quality scaffolding equipment to ensure safety and reliability.
   - Set up a warehouse or storage facility for equipment and materials.
Marketing and Branding
   - Develop a professional website and marketing materials.
   - Launch initial marketing campaigns to build brand awareness.

Legal and Compliance
   - Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations.
   - Obtain necessary licenses and permits for operating a scaffolding business.

 Expanding Reach
Market Research
   - Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and target markets.
   - Analyze competitor strategies and adjust business plans accordingly.

 Operational Efficiency
   - Implement an inventory management system to track materials and equipment.
   - Optimize project management processes to ensure timely and efficient service delivery.

. Customer Relationship Management
   - Develop a CRM system to manage customer interactions and improve service quality.
   - Establish a customer support team to handle inquiries and resolve issues promptly.

 Partnerships and Networking
   - Build relationships with construction firms, contractors, and suppliers.
   - Join industry associations and attend trade shows to network and gain insights.

Scaling and Innovation
Technology Integration
   - Invest in technology solutions to streamline operations, such as project management software and mobile apps.
   - Explore innovative scaffolding techniques and materials to stay ahead of industry trends.

 Sustainability Initiatives
   - Implement sustainable practices in operations, such as recycling materials and reducing waste.
   - Seek certifications for sustainability to enhance company reputation.

 Financial Management
   - Develop a financial strategy to manage cash flow, reduce costs, and increase profitability.
   
 Expansion and Diversification
  - Identify new markets and expand operations geographically.
   - Diversify service offerings to include related services such as maintenance, custom solutions, and consulting.

Continuous Improvement
   - Establish a culture of continuous improvement, encouraging feedback and innovation from employees.

column32:
Year 1: Establishing a Strong Foundation
1. **Market Penetration**:
   - Secure contracts with at least 10 major construction companies.
   - Achieve a market share of 5% in the local scaffolding market.

2. **Operational Excellence**:
   - Set up a robust inventory management system to track scaffolding materials.
   - Hire and train a team of 15 skilled workers.

3. **Brand Building**:
   - Develop a comprehensive marketing strategy, including an optimized website and active social media presence.
   - Participate in at least 3 industry trade shows or exhibitions to increase brand visibility.

4. **Safety and Compliance**:
   - Ensure all staff are trained in safety protocols and certified in compliance with industry standards.
   - Conduct quarterly safety audits to maintain high safety standard 
Year 2: Expansion and Growth
1. **Geographic Expansion**:
   - Expand operations to two new cities or regions.
   - Establish partnerships with local suppliers and contractors in the new markets.

2. **Revenue Goals**:
   - Increase annual revenue by 50% compared to Year 1.
   - Diversify service offerings to include custom scaffolding solutions and maintenance services.

3. **Customer Satisfaction**:
   - Implement a customer feedback system to continually improve service quality.
   - Achieve a customer satisfaction rate of at least 90%.

4. **Innovation and Technology**:
   - Invest in advanced scaffolding technology and equipment to improve efficiency.
   - Develop a mobile app for better project management and client communication.

Year 3: Leading the Market
1. **Market Leadership**:
   - Capture a 15% market share in the regional scaffolding market.
   - Become a preferred scaffolding provider for at least 20 major construction firms.

2. **Financial Stability**:
   - Achieve a net profit margin of 20%.
   - Build a financial reserve to support further expansion and innovation.

3. **Sustainability Initiatives**:
   - Implement eco-friendly practices in operations, such as recycling materials and reducing waste.
   - Obtain industry certifications for sustainability and environmental responsibility.

4. **Talent Development**:
   - Establish an in-house training program to continuously upgrade employee skills.
   - Create a leadership development program to identify and nurture future leaders within the company.
column33:
Building the Foundation
Capital and Funding
   - Secure initial funding to purchase essential scaffolding equipment and materials.
   - Establish a line of credit or obtain a business loan for operational expenses.

Infrastructure and Equipment
   - Acquire high-quality scaffolding equipment to ensure safety and reliability.
   - Set up a warehouse or storage facility for equipment and materials.
Marketing and Branding
   - Develop a professional website and marketing materials.
   - Launch initial marketing campaigns to build brand awareness.

Legal and Compliance
   - Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations.
   - Obtain necessary licenses and permits for operating a scaffolding business.

 Expanding Reach
Market Research
   - Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and target markets.
   - Analyze competitor strategies and adjust business plans accordingly.

 Operational Efficiency

   - Optimize project management processes to ensure timely and efficient service delivery.

. Customer Relationship Management

column32:
Over the next three years, my business aims to achieve the following objectives:

1. Establish a permanent facility to serve as our operational hub, enabling us to streamline processes and increase efficiency.
2. Diversify into farming, leveraging opportunities in agriculture to drive growth and sustainability.
3. Create employment opportunities, with a focus on empowering young people and contributing to the development of the next generation of leaders in our industry.
column33:
Our mission is to empower women, foster economic growth, and provide natural solutions to enhance immune function and combat fatigue. We aim to achieve this by:

- Creating a platform that uplifts and supports women in their personal and professional lives
- Generating job opportunities that promote financial independence and stability
- Offering innovative, natural products that promote overall wellness and resilience

By pursuing this mission, we strive to make a positive impact on our community, promote sustainable living, and inspire a healthier, more balanced lifestyle.
column34:
We have natural smoothies/supplements. 

Our first product is the Herbal smoothie, 

The second product is the Balanced smoothie.

With the herbal smoothie, adding a small portion of this to your daily diet while on your periods, you will notice a reduction in your menstrual pains, have a more balanced menstrual cycle. Menopausal symptoms are also reported by women to be manageable on the product.

With the balanced smoothie, adding this intermittently into your diet has been reported to assist in improving overall health, an immune booster which also helps achieve better controlled chronic conditions as well as an increased libido.

column33:
Our business is to install alarms, cameras, electric fences, perimeter fencing, gate motors, intercoms, etc. to business and commercial clients around Sekhukhune land. 

We have also provided so far 4 free panic units to cover 12 houses to try fight crime in our community. 

Our needs are transport to or from work or marketing, skill development,   business workshops on how to grow the business and proper mentorship

column32:
Ambitious, I know, however I would like to have a running manufacturing and retailing system for KEIGH Cosmetics (as a subsidiary of Maharani Crown) selling cosmetics formulated and manufactured by us. By the end of 3 years, I would like to either lease or own a warehouse sub-sectioned to run KEIGH Cosmetics fully and independently. 

I would also like to infiltrate the mining industry by sourcing and supplying equipment and tools; being a certified reseller of a few international brands used in the mining industry wouldn't hurt either.
column33:
I would like to be assisted in creating a holding company in order for me to venture and achieve different business avenues independently. 

I desperately need to be taken under someone's wing to be groomed into one of the most successfully diverse businesswomen in Africa, if not the world. 

Help me plan out all these ideas into real businesses; taking into consideration that failure is inevitable however not reason enough to quit on my ultimate goal and desire.

column2: Mahlodi Le Mampuru Trading and Projects
column11: BSc (Hons) - Quantity Surveying - University of Witwatersrand
column32:
Short-term (1 year):

1. Increase revenue by 20% through improved operational efficiency and customer retention.
2. Enhance logistics services to achieve a 95% on-time delivery rate.
3. Complete 3 construction projects with a total value of R5 million.

Medium-term (2 years):

1. Expand logistics services to include warehousing and distribution.
2. Increase construction project portfolio to a total value of R20 million.
3. Develop a specialized engineering service offering (e.g., project management, civil engineering).

Long-term (3 years):

1. Achieve a 50% market share in the SME logistics and construction sector.
2. Establish a strong reputation as a reliable and innovative engineering services provider.
3. Increase revenue by 100% through sustained growth and expansion.

Additional goals:

- Improve cash flow management and reduce debt by 30%.
- Develop a strong company culture and increase employee retention by 25%.
- Enhance technology infrastructure to support business growth and efficiency
column34: Construction, Manufacturing, Waste Management, Engineering And Environmental Services

column32: To see the business operating on the right direction and growing with recommendations
column33:
I started making shoes for as long as i can remember after my parents left me over 15 years ago using self made hand tools and as the business was my guardian itself (hand to mouth) and as the machinery was expensive so i struggled for over 5 years to get 2nd hand manual industrial leather patch machine ;so i pushed for 2 years and managed to get a manual shoe stretcher machine.

So just because i was now having possible equipment to make my job easy and local people being informed so i start making self design shoes ;sandals; push ins and etc. And although I was working only with those who placed orders;then again the volume of shoe repairs and renewals increase rapidly; it's when i get to realise that i will never manage to do this by my own and that was when i got to get 3 casual helpers/workers.

And so because of the sluggish/slowness of the business operations and profit generation due to the fact that the machine is operating manually i won't be able to afford to pay them adequately if they where full time.

And therefore the need of the business is that :it requires a fully automatic operating machinery /equipment together with the required tools and the right material so that things will be done at mass or in bulk with good quality to ensure greater profitability and expansion.

column15: Repairs And Creation Of Various Leather Goods

column32:
Our business goals 

1. **Increase Brand Awareness and Market Presence**: Enhance the visibility of the company through targeted marketing campaigns, social media engagement, and partnerships with local vineyards and event planners.

2. **Expand Service Offerings**: Develop new wine tasting themes and mobile bar experiences to cater to different audiences, such as corporate events, weddings, and private parties.

3. **Boost Customer Retention and Satisfaction**: Implement a loyalty program and gather customer feedback to continuously improve the service, ensuring a memorable and high-quality experience for all clients.

4. **Grow Revenue and Profit Margins**: Optimize pricing strategies, reduce operational costs, and explore additional revenue streams, such as selling branded merchandise or offering exclusive wine club memberships.

5. **Establish Strategic Partnerships**: Collaborate with local wineries, restaurants, and hospitality venues to create mutually beneficial partnerships that enhance the overall customer experience and increase business opportunities.
6. *Acquire and Launch Mobile Bar Services:* Invest in and acquire mobile bar units to expand service offerings, ensuring they are equipped to provide a high-quality and professional bar experience at various events.
7. *Train Staff for Mobile Bar Operations:* Develop a comprehensive training program for staff to ensure they are well-versed in mobile bar setup, customer service, and mixology to deliver an exceptional guest experience.
column34:
Primary services & products 

For a company that hosts wine tasting events and offers mobile bar services, the primary services could include:

1. **Wine Tasting Events**: Organizing and hosting wine tasting events at various locations, including detailed presentations about different wines, wine pairing advice, and expert-led tasting sessions.
2. *Wine Gift Hampers:* Creating and selling beautifully curated wine gift hampers that include a selection of fine wines, gourmet snacks, and wine accessories, ideal for gifts, corporate giveaways, and special occasions.

2. **Mobile Bar Services**: Providing fully equipped mobile bars for events, complete with professional bartenders, a wide selection of beverages, and customizable drink menus tailored to the client's preferences and event theme.

3. **Event Planning and Coordination**: Offering comprehensive event planning services that include venue selection, theme development, and coordination of all event details to ensure a seamless and memorable experience.

4. **Corporate and Private Event Services**: Specializing in hosting and servicing corporate events, private parties, weddings, and other special occasions, providing tailored wine tasting experiences and bar services to fit the event's needs.
5. *Glass Rentals:* Offering a rental service for high-quality glassware for events, ensuring clients have the perfect glasses for their wine tastings and events.

column32: Able to expand farm operations from 12 hectares to 50 hectares and establish Avocado farming on a 30 hectares space. Also plant to freeze-dry vegetables for export market
column33: The farm I was allocated by my uncle, who is the Traditional leader of Manoke village, has rich sandy-loam soil, has adequate river and borehole water and located 5km closer to 80% of my potential clients. I need assistance with 2x solar-based water pumps to replace the damaged pumps, purchase of net for harsh climate conditions as I lost 95% of my harvest last hear due to a heat wave and damaged borehole pumps. I had to be withdrawn from tertiary studies as both my parents were unemployed and couldn't secure funding. My uncle (Chief Manok), allocated me 20 hectares to sustain myself and us the revenue to finish my Degree in Business Strategy. The Anglo American Zimela fund enterprise development intervention will help me to build my future and take along others who are experiencing similar realities

column32:
My goals are: 
1. To establish a market presence by securing initial contracts and expand our client base in the construction and mining sectors. 
2. Refine core services and introduce new ones based on market demand. 
3.To recruit, train and continuously up-skill employees to ensure high-quality service delivery. 
4. Invest in essential tools, equipment, and technology to streamline operations and improve productivity. 
5. Collaborate with key suppliers and industry partners to ensure a reliable supply chain and increase business opportunities. 
6. Secure funding, manage finances prudently, and achieve sustainable growth by optimizing costs and increasing revenue streams.
7. Establish a strong local presence and explore opportunities to expand services to other regions with significant mining activities.
column33: Although my business was registered in 2021, it has not yet been operating. We are now fully prepared to launch and are seeking opportunities and support to start providing high-quality construction services and mining support. Our immediate needs include securing initial contracts, funding for essential tools and equipment, and building strategic partnerships with key players in the mining industry. We are committed to delivering exceptional service and contributing to the growth and development of the local economy.
column34: General contracting, construction services, mining equipment supply and general supplies of construction materials and equipment to support projects

Short-term goals (1 year):
Successfully register and become an approved supplier for Anglo American's supplier program.
Develop a comprehensive understanding of Anglo American's procurement processes and requirements.
Establish relationships with key decision-makers and stakeholders within Anglo American.
Achieve a minimum of R1 million in revenue from sales to Anglo American within the first year.
Medium-term goals (2-3 years):
Expand product/service offerings to meet the growing demands of Anglo American's mining projects.
Increase revenue from Anglo American to R5 million within the next 2-3 years.
Develop strategic partnerships with other suppliers to enhance offerings and improve competitiveness.
Achieve a minimum of 20% annual growth in sales to Anglo American.
Long-term goals (beyond 3 years):
Become a preferred supplier for Anglo American's mining projects.
Expand services to other major mining companies in South Africa and globally.
Develop a reputation as a reliable, innovative, and customer-centric supplier in the mining industry
